page.title: 05AT PLAY IN SANTON DOWNHAM
page.content: The village has no Public House or Cafe and so all indoor activities centre around the Village Hall which belongs to the F.C. The hall has a separate licensed bar which is open only to members; however members and groups are allowed to take personal friends and visiting teams for darts matches etc. The other end of the hall is quite large and seats over 100 people. It is regularly used by the W.I. and an Over 60's Club etc. and can be hired for parties and functions such as Jumble Sales. The village has active football and cricket teams which play on the village green, but a bowls green and tennis court were allowed to lapse about 10yrs ago. Horse riding is allowed along marked trails and small boats can be used on the river.
